data.title: Minnesota Department of Agriculture
data.meta_description: Cold Hardiness List 2024 UPDATE for the 2024 season was an editorial change to Chestnu
data.text:
Cold Hardiness List 2024

UPDATE for the 2024 season was an editorial change to Chestnut Crabapple to Fruiting Apple Zone 3 and removed it from Malus Flowering Crabapple. For ease of online viewing plant species with multiple cultivars/varieties have been combined into one species line.

This list will be used to identify false or misleading USDA plant hardiness zone labeling of plants offered for sale which is a violation of Minnesota Statute 18H.14. This statute requires that:

Plants, plant materials, or nursery stock must not be labeled or advertised with false or misleading information including, but not limited to, scientific name, variety, place of origin, hardiness zone as defined by the United States Department of Agriculture, and growth habit.

All nonhardy nursery stock as designated by the commissioner must be labeled correctly for hardiness or be labeled "nonhardy" in Minnesota.

Cultivars are listed separately if supporting information has been presented. Particularly if the cultivar varies in hardiness from the species. If the cultivar is not listed refer to the species for appropriate plant hardiness zone.

This list is annually reviewed and updated online in the fall. If you have questions or would like a Microsoft Excel file of the list, please contact the Nursery Program, 651-201-6507. To search the list by common or Latin name, utilize the control find (Ctrl, F) function of your computer.

The MDA will be reviewing and solicitating new plants to be listed in January 2025, through September 1, 2024. The MDA does not restrict plants from being sold that are not listed on the MDA Cold Hardiness List, however plants that are not labeled for cold hardiness and are not cold hardy in the area in which they are being sold must be labeled “nonhardy.” It is recommended that all plants be tagged with an accurate plant hardiness zone.

In fall of 2023 the USDA made changes to the USDA Plant Hardiness Zone Map. This does not have any impact on the MDA’s Cold Hardiness list designations. For information on the USDA Plant Hardiness Zone Map can be found on the University of Minnesota Extension website.
